oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Residues of copper and sulphur on fruits from organic orchards
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Kelderer, Markus
Matteazzi, Aldo
Casera, Claudio
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Crop health, quality, protection
Fruit and berries
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Copper und sulphur compounds are listed in annex 2b of the EC regulation 2091/92 and are used in organic orchards to control scab, mildew and sooty blotch also during summer time. In Italy, copper compounds have a waiting period from 20 days between last treatment and harvest, for sulphur compounds it differs and can reach until 30 days for lime sulphur. The trials carried out showed that using the recommended low dosages for copper and lime sulphur it should not be a problem to reduce these waiting periods. The residues remained clearly under the legal values, also when the samples where collected the same day of the treatment.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Kelderer, Markus; Matteazzi, Aldo and Casera, Claudio (2004) Residues of copper and sulphur on fruits from organic orchards. [Bestimmung der Schwefel- und Kupferrückstände an Früchten aus dem biologischen Obstbau.] In: Boos, Markus (Ed.) Ecofruit - 11th International Conference on Cultivation Technique and Phytopathological Problems in Organic Fruit-Growing: Proceedings to the Conference from 3rd February to 5th February 2004 at Weinsberg/Germany, pp. 213-216.
